section.title: Emphasis
section.sectiontitle: To emphasise a noun use the structure: It is / was ... which / that
section.text1: I particularly like the kitchen in that house.
section.text1a: It's the kitchen that I particularly like about that house.
section.text2: He was most proud of his first novel
section.text2a: It was his first novel that he was most proud of.
section.sectiontitle2: To emphasise a verb use an appropriate form of do.
section.text3: I wish you could stay a bit longer.
section.text3a: I do wish you could stay a bit longer.

section.title: Emphasis
section.sectiontitle: Use repetition to emphasise an intensifier such as very or really.
section.text2: It was a really expensive gift.
section.text2a: It was a really, really expensive gift.
section.sectiontitle2: Use emphasising words e.g. such a, really, just and so.
section.text3: I was pleased to meet your sister.
section.text3a: I was so pleased to meet your sister.
